issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
As per below report https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/17517/artifact/patchprocess/patch-compile-root.txt
there s a random issue generated by 'npm install' during build.

This jira is to track the same.
fields.summary: Update npm to latest version in Dockerfile to avoid random failures of npm while run maven build

comments.body: Attaching  a patch to fix random error.

This message was automatically generated.

That looks working well. cc/  [~leftnoteasy]

Ideally 'npm install' could fail with the mentioned exception, in that case we need to invoke 'npm cache clean' and then retry 'npm install' again.

But maven wont help to do conditional re-execution in easier way. Hence I wrote a script to do that and then made as an executable from maven exec plugin. Looks everything is working fine. Please help to check the same. Also pls suggest where to place this 'build.sh' file.
Attached ver.4 patch, which updated npm version to latest
